title: Lookup datasets
text: risk pairs data also two versions (AppRiskPairData RiskPairData): differences abs_risk column, absolute value RiskFactor (easily added)
code: waldo::compare(   names(segtools::AppRiskPairData),   names(segtools::RiskPairData) ) #> `old[2:5]`: "REF" "BGM" "RiskFactor" "abs_risk" #> `new[2:4]`: "REF" "BGM" "RiskFactor"  waldo::compare(   segtools::AppRiskPairData$REF,   segtools::RiskPairData$REF ) #> ✔ No differences waldo::compare(   segtools::AppRiskPairData$BGM,   segtools::RiskPairData$BGM ) #> ✔ No differences  waldo::compare(   segtools::AppRiskPairData$RiskFactor,   segtools::RiskPairData$RiskFactor ) #> ✔ No differences waldo::compare(   # abs_risk in AppRiskPairData   segtools::AppRiskPairData$abs_risk,   # abs of RiskFactor in RiskPairData   abs(segtools::RiskPairData$RiskFactor) ) #> ✔ No differences

title: segtools
text: Assume .csv file like one package inst/extdata/ folder: segtools can create following:

title: segtools
text: summary tables rely separate functions table.

title: segtools
text: seg_pairs_table() returns pairs comparing BGM REF

title: segtools
text: MARD table requires two functions: seg_risk_vars() calculate intermediate risk variables seg_mard_table() calculate Bias, MARD, CV, lower/upper 95% CI

title: segtools
text: seg_risk_grade_table() returns table risk grades

title: segtools
text: seg_risk_level_table() return table risk levels categories

title: segtools
text: seg_iso_range_table() returns table compliance ranges

title: segtools
text: seg_binom_table() returns table binomial test compliant pairs

title: segtools
text: segtools can also create following graphs:

title: segtools
code: seg_grid(   data = test_data,   is_path = FALSE,   alpha_var = 3 / 4,   size_var = 2.5,   color_var = "gray85" )

title: SEG shiny app tables
text: vignette, ’m going compare results segtools package shiny application Diabetes technology society website.

title: SEG shiny app tables
text: ’ll load test data used GitHub repo (VanderbiltComplete.csv)
code: github_data_root <-   "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/mjfrigaard/seg-shiny-data/master/Data/" full_sample_repo <- base::paste0(github_data_root,   "VanderbiltComplete.csv") test_vand_comp_data <-   vroom::vroom(file = full_sample_repo, delim = ",") glimpse(test_vand_comp_data) #> Rows: 9,891 #> Columns: 2 #> $ BGM <dbl> 121, 212, 161, 191, 189, 104, 293, 130, 261, 147, 83, 132, 146, 24… #> $ REF <dbl> 127, 223, 166, 205, 210, 100, 296, 142, 231, 148, 81, 131, 155, 25…

title: SEG shiny app tables
text: uploading VanderbiltComplete.csv, first table Summary Tables tab pairs table:  test segtools package function, ’ll need store table something can test (app_pairs_tbl) output segtools::seg_pairs_table() function pkg_pairs_tbl
code: app_pairs_tbl = tibble::as_tibble(data.frame(   stringsAsFactors = FALSE,   check.names = FALSE,   `Pair Type` = c(     "Total",     "BGM < REF",     "BGM = REF",     "BGM > REF",     "REF > 600: Excluded from SEG Analysis",     "Total included in SEG Analysis"   ),   Count = c(9891L, 4710L, 479L, 4702L, 23L, 9868L) )) app_pairs_tbl pkg_pairs_tbl <-      seg_pairs_table(data = test_vand_comp_data,                     is_path = FALSE) pkg_pairs_tbl

title: SEG shiny app tables
text: Test application output package output:
code: testthat::test_that("Test pair type table", {   testthat::expect_equal(     # function table     object = pkg_pairs_tbl,      # application table     expected = app_pairs_tbl   ) }) #> Test passed 🥇

title: SEG shiny app tables
text: MARD table application :  Store app MARD table something can test seg_mard_table() outpput (app_mard). ’ll store output seg_mard_table() pkg_mard:
code: app_mard <- tibble::tibble(     Total = 9868L,     Bias = "0.6%",     MARD = "7%",     CV = "14.8%",     `Lower 95% Limit of Agreement` = "-28.3%",     `Upper 95% Limit of Agreement` = "29.6%") app_mard pkg_mard <- tibble::as_tibble(   seg_mard_table(data = test_vand_comp_data, is_path = FALSE)) pkg_mard

title: SEG shiny app tables
text: test MARD tabels
code: testthat::test_that("Test MARD table values", { testthat::expect_equal(   # function table   object = pkg_mard,    # application table   expected = app_mard   ) }) #> Test passed 🎉

title: SEG shiny app tables
text: risk grade level little trickier replicate ’s structure (need wrap output tibble data.frame). package function creating risk grade table seg_risk_grade_table() (store pkg_risk_grade_table)
code: app_risk_grade_table <- as.data.frame(   tibble::tibble(     ID = c(1L, 2L, 3L, 4L, 5L),     `Risk Grade` = c('A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E'),     `Number of Pairs` = c(9474L, 349L, 35L, 10L, NA_integer_),     Percent = c('96%', '3.5%', '0.4%', '0.1%', NA_character_),     `Risk Factor Range` = c('0 - 0.5', '> 0.5 - 1.5', '> 1.5 - 2.5',       '> 2.5 - 3.5', '> 3.5'),   ) ) app_risk_grade_table pkg_risk_grade_table <- segtools::seg_risk_grade_table(   data = test_vand_comp_data, is_path = FALSE) pkg_risk_grade_table

title: SEG shiny app tables
text: ’ll limit test Number Pairs column make sure ’s match.
code: testthat::test_that("Test risk grade table", { testthat::expect_equal(   # function table   object = pkg_risk_grade_table$`Number of Pairs`,    # application table   expected = app_risk_grade_table$`Number of Pairs`   ) }) #> Test passed 🎊

title: SEG shiny app tables
text: app display risk level table.  re-creation table (testing)
code: app_risk_level_table <- as.data.frame(   tibble::tibble(     `SEG Risk Level` = c(0L, 1L, 2L, 3L, 4L, 5L, 6L, 7L),     `SEG Risk Category` = c(       'None',        'Slight, Lower', 'Slight, Higher',       'Moderate, Lower','Moderate, Higher',       'Severe, Lower', 'Severe, Higher',       'Extreme'     ),     `Number of Pairs` = c(9474L, 249L, 55L, 24L, 11L, 10L, NA_integer_, NA_integer_),     Percent = c(       '96%', '3%', '0.6%', '0.2%', '0.1%', '0.1%', NA_character_, NA_character_     ),   ) ) app_risk_level_table pkg_risk_level_table <- seg_risk_level_table(data = test_vand_comp_data,                                                is_path = FALSE) pkg_risk_level_table

title: SEG shiny app tables
text: ’ll limit test Number Pairs column make sure ’s match.
code: waldo::compare(   # function table   x = pkg_risk_level_table$`Number of Pairs`,   # application table   y = app_risk_level_table$`Number of Pairs`   ) #> `old[1:5]`: 9474 294 55 24 11 #> `new[1:5]`: 9474 249 55 24 11
